item.title: Setting up a Host
item.description:
You can add or edit your hosting information by selecting the … button next to “Edit Content” and clicking “Hosting Info”.

You can choose between:

  • GitHub Pages
  • Bitbucket
  • FTP/FTPS/SFTP
  • AWS S3
  • Or to just commit back to your source repository

To choose “Commit to source repo only” you will have to have imported your project from GitHub or Bitbucket. If you choose “Commit to source repo only” we won’t publish your site to a host. Instead we will only commit the source code of your site back to the repository you imported from.

For more information on each of the hosting options please visit:

  • list of links to respsecitve hosting pages

item.title: Re-uploading a Project
item.description:
If you’re not using GitHub with forestry, and you need to re-upload your project, you can upload your project files only, or you can upload content and project files.

Choosing project files only will overwrite things like:

  • Config file
  • Layouts files
  • Static Assets
  • Etc

If you choose to update project files AND content files, you will also overwrite:

  • Content files, such as posts and pages
  • Data files

Finally, if you want to update your local copy of your site, see downloading a backup.

item.title: Generate AWS Keys
item.description:
You'll need your region, bucket name, AWS key and Secret in order to deploy your site to S3. 

Setup Policy

  • Log into your AWS Console
  • Go to Identity and Access Management
  • Policies > Get started > Create policies > policy generator
  • Add the following fields:

AWS Service: Amazon S3
Action: All actions selected (for simplicity)
ARN: arn:aws:s3:::your-domain.com/*

  • Click Add Statement
  • Now do the same thing without the /* at the end of your domain (in the ARN field)
  • Click Next and give the policy a new name that makes sense (forestry-policy).  Then click Create Policy

Attach Policy to a User

Go back to the Identity and Access Management dashboard and go to:

  • Users > create > name (name = forestry)
  • Click show credentials (be sure to copy or download these...they only appear once)
  • Close window then click on the row of the user you just created
  • Got to Permissions > Attach policy then search for the policy you just created
  • Save and your done!

item.title: Import from a repository
item.description:
If you import a git repository, Forestry will commit updates to your repository and watch it for changes.

When an editor saves changes in Forestry, 2 things happen:

  • All changes are committed and pushed to your GitHub repo
  • The site is compiled and sent to your host (FTP, S3, GitHub pages, etc)

When an dev pushes changes:

  • Forestry pulls in updates.
